SEARCH
Package org.newsclub.net.unix

Class ThroughputTest<A extends SocketAddress>

java.lang.Object
org.newsclub.net.unix.SocketTestBase<A>
org.newsclub.net.unix.ThroughputTest<A>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ThroughputTest, ThroughputTest, ThroughputTest, ThroughputTest
@TestMethodOrder(org.junit.jupiter.api.MethodOrderer.MethodName.class) public abstract class ThroughputTest<A extends SocketAddress> extends SocketTestBase<A>
This test measures throughput for sending and receiving messages over AF_UNIX, comparing implementations of junixsocket and JEP 380 (Java 16). The test is enabled by default (only runs for a very short time), and is also included within the self-test. The tests can be configured as follows (all system properties):
  • org.newsclub.net.unix.throughput-test.enabled (0/1, default: 1)
  • org.newsclub.net.unix.throughput-test.payload-size (bytes, e.g., 8192)
  • org.newsclub.net.unix.throughput-test.payload-size.datagram (bytes, e.g., 2048; defaults to value specified with "payload-size" above)
  • org.newsclub.net.unix.throughput-test.seconds (default: 0)
Author:
Christian Kohlschütter

    • shouldDoConnectionCheckUponAccept

      protected boolean shouldDoConnectionCheckUponAccept()
      Description copied from class: SocketTestBase
      Checks if an optional connection check via AFSocket.checkConnectionClosed(), is to be run upon AFServerSocket.accept(). Override to enable.
      Overrides:
      shouldDoConnectionCheckUponAccept in class SocketTestBase<A extends SocketAddress>
      Returns:
      true if enabled; default is false = disabled.
